CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Proposal Sent stage positioned above or below the Contract Signed stage?
SRP.A: The Proposal Sent stage is positioned {above} the Contract Signed stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Contract Signed?
VE.A: The value of stage Contract Signed is {511}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Proposal Sent?
VE.A: The value of stage Proposal Sent is {804}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Initial Contact, with a value of {1680}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Contract Signed, with a value of {511}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Initial Contact to stage Needs Analysis?
SC.A: Decreased by {486} Clients from stage Initial Contact to stage Needs Analysis.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 999? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Initial Contact} stage has {1680}, the {Needs Analysis} stage has {1194}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 999? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Proposal Sent} stage has {804}, the {Negotiation} stage has {604}, the {Contract Signed} stage has {511}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 557 and 999? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Proposal Sent} stage has {804}, the {Negotiation} stage has {604}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Proposal Sent to Negotiation, or from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Needs Analysis} to {Proposal Sent} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent, from stage Negotiation to Contract Signed, or from stage Proposal Sent to Negotiation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Needs Analysis} to stage {Proposal Sent} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Initial Contact} and {Needs Analysis} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Negotiation} and {Contract Signed} stages.
